actions.committee: House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries.
Reported to House from the Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries with amendment, H. Rept. 96-1221.
Measure called up under motion to suspend rules and pass in House.
Senate agreed to House amendment with an amendment.

official_title: An act to authorize the documentation of certain vessels as vessels of the United States, and for other purposes.

summary.as: Senate agreed to House amendment with amendment
summary.text: (Senate agreed to House amendments with an amendment) Directs the Secretary of the department in which the Coast Guard is operating to document the vessels Sara, Aurelia Four, Alice, Albatross, Hillbilly I, and Kailua as vessels with the privileges of engaging in coastwise trade, so long as each such vessel is owned by a citizen of the United States. Directs that the vessel Sara be granted such privileges only so long as it is owned by a citizen of the United States and is operated for a nonprofit purpose. Amends the Merchant Marine Act, 1936 to authorize the Secretary of Commerce to procure and install national defense features on specified United States merchant ships. Directs the Secretary to submit the plans and specifications for such national defense features to the Navy Department for approval. Requires the Secretary of the Navy to certify approval of such plans to the Secretary of commerce. Grants to vessels engaged in the coastwise transportation of domestic coal from one United States port to another, priority to load at such ports before vessels engaged in exporting coal. Authorizes the Secretary to eliminate such priority loading and to report such action to Congress within 30 days. Allows the vessel Scuba King to be documented to engage in the fisheries and coastwise trade so long as it is owned by a citizen of the United States.

titles.title: A bill to authorize the documentation of the vessel, Sara, as a vessel of the United States with coastwise privileges.
An act to authorize the documentation of certain vessels as vessels of the United States, and for other purposes.
